publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-331 Tommy Sheridan: European Working Time Directive—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish National Party, Conservative and Liberal Democrat MEPs who voted in the European Parliament to extend the European Working Time Directive to cover junior hospital doctors; regrets that Scottish Labour MEPs failed to support this motion, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to introduce immediately shorter hours for Scottish doctors.
S1M-331 European Working Time Directive (lodged on 26 November 1999) Linda Fabiani*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-331 European Working Time Directive (lodged on 26 November 1999) Kay Ullrich*, Michael Matheson*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*

S1M-331 Tommy Sheridan: European Working Time Directive—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish National Party, Conservative and Liberal Democrat MEPs who voted in the European Parliament to extend the European Working Time Directive to cover junior hospital doctors; regrets that Scottish Labour MEPs failed to support this motion, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to introduce immediately shorter hours for Scottish doctors. Supported by: Linda Fabiani, Roseanna Cunningham, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Kay Ullrich, Michael Matheson, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Kenneth Gibson
S1M-331 European Working Time Directive (lodged on 26 November 1999) Fiona McLeod*, Ben Wallace*
S1M-331 European Working Time Directive (lodged on 26 November 1999) Mr David Davidson*
S1M-331 European Working Time Directive (lodged on 26 November 1999) Dorothy-Grace Elder*

S1M-331 Tommy Sheridan: European Working Time Directive—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish National Party, Conservative and Liberal Democrat MEPs who voted in the European Parliament to extend the European Working Time Directive to cover junior hospital doctors; regrets that Scottish Labour MEPs failed to support this motion, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to introduce immediately shorter hours for Scottish doctors. Supported by: Linda Fabiani, Roseanna Cunningham, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Kay Ullrich, Michael Matheson, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Fiona McLeod, Ben Wallace, Mr David Davidson, Dorothy-Grace Elder
S1M-331 European Working Time Directive (lodged on 26 November 1999) Shona Robison*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-331 European Working Time Directive (lodged on 26 November 1999) Alasdair Morgan*
S1M-331 European Working Time Directive (lodged on 26 November 1999) Alex Neil*
S1M-331 European Working Time Directive (lodged on 26 November 1999) Donald Gorrie*

S1M-331 Tommy Sheridan: European Working Time Directive—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish National Party, Conservative and Liberal Democrat MEPs who voted in the European Parliament to extend the European Working Time Directive to cover junior hospital doctors; regrets that Scottish Labour MEPs failed to support this motion, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to introduce immediately shorter hours for Scottish doctors. Supported by: Linda Fabiani, Roseanna Cunningham, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Kay Ullrich, Michael Matheson, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Fiona McLeod, Ben Wallace, Mr David Davidson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Andrew Wilson, Alasdair Morgan, Alex Neil, Donald Gorrie
S1M-331 European Working Time Directive (lodged on 26 November 1999) Nick Johnston*, Brian Adam*

S1M-331 Tommy Sheridan: European Working Time Directive—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish National Party, Conservative and Liberal Democrat MEPs who voted in the European Parliament to extend the European Working Time Directive to cover junior hospital doctors; regrets that Scottish Labour MEPs failed to support this motion, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to introduce immediately shorter hours for Scottish doctors. Supported by: Linda Fabiani, Roseanna Cunningham, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Kay Ullrich, Michael Matheson, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Fiona McLeod, Ben Wallace, Mr David Davidson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Andrew Wilson, Alasdair Morgan, Alex Neil, Donald Gorrie, Nick Johnston, Brian Adam
S1M-331 European Working Time Directive (lodged on 26 November 1999) Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Michael Russell*

S1M-331 Tommy Sheridan: European Working Time Directive—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish National Party, Conservative and Liberal Democrat MEPs who voted in the European Parliament to extend the European Working Time Directive to cover junior hospital doctors; regrets that Scottish Labour MEPs failed to support this motion, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to introduce immediately shorter hours for Scottish doctors. Supported by: Linda Fabiani, Roseanna Cunningham, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Kay Ullrich, Michael Matheson, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Fiona McLeod, Ben Wallace, Mr David Davidson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Andrew Wilson, Alasdair Morgan, Alex Neil, Donald Gorrie, Nick Johnston, Brian Adam, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Michael Russell
